question: The purpose of a basic Oscillator is to:

choices.choice: amplify a signal
attenuate a signal
produce a sine wave from a DC input
increase the frequency of a sine wave

subject: Technical

question: A basic oscillator consists of 1. amplifier 2. positive feedback path 3. negative feedback path 4. frequency determining circuit 5. DC supply 6. AC supply
subject: Technical

question: An electrical resonant circuit is constructed from:

choices.choice: esistors and inductors in series
inductors and resistors in series or parallel
nductors and resistors always in parallel
apacitor and inductor which may be in parallel or series

subject: Technical

question: When a parallel inductive capacitive circuit is operating at its resonant frequency:

choices.choice: capacitive reactance is greater than inductive reactance
inductive reactance is greater than capacitive reactance
inductive reactance equals capacitive reactance and a large circulating current exists
inductive reactance equals capacitive reactance and zero current flows in the circuit

subject: Technical

choices.choice: decreases as frequency increases
increases as frequency increases
remains constant with changes in frequency
remains constant up to approximately 30MHz and then decreases with increasing frequency
decreases as frequency increases
increases as frequency increases
remains constant with changes in frequency
effectively falls to zero at VHF and above

question: In a LC circuit the frequency where XL = XC is called: Look at the circuit at annex A and answer the following 3 questions

choices.choice: Impedance (Z)
Cancellation point
Oscillation frequency (F0)
Resonant frequency (F0)

subject: Technical

question: Which components form the resonant circuit and control the frequency of operation: 1. C1 2. L1 3. TR1 4. L2 5. C2

choices.choice: 1 and 2 only
3 only

subject: Technical

question: The NPN transistor TR1 is necessary to:

choices.choice: form the positive feedback path to maintain oscillations
act as the frequency controlling device
act as an amplifier and make up for losses in the circuit
form the negative feedback path to maintain oscillations

subject: Technical

choices.choice: is provided by transistor TR1
is provided by transformer coupling between L1 and L2
is not necessary, the oscillations are maintained by negative feedback
is determined by the ratio of C1 to L1

question: In the circuit at Annex A it is necessary to make the output frequency variable. This could be achieved by:

choices.choice: replacing C1 with a variable capacitor
placing a variable resistor in the emitter of TR1
increasing the turns ratio of L1 - L2
making the gain of transistor TR1 variable

subject: Technical

choices.choice: the resonation when XL = XC
the generation of sine waves by an oscillator
a quartz crystal vibrating at a frequency dependent on its thickness when an EMF is applied to it
a quartz crystal vibrating at a frequency dependent on the size of the EMF applied to it

question: Look at the circuit at Annex B. This shows:

choices.choice: an audio frequency amplifier
a radio frequency amplifier
crystal controlled oscillator
a LC controlled oscillator

subject: Technical

question: The advantages of a crystal controlled oscillator over a LC controlled oscillator include: 1. cheapness of construction 2. precise stable frequency output 3. Very narrow bandwidth 4. frequency can easily be changed

choices.choice: 2 and 3 only
there are no particular advantages

subject: Technical

question: The output frequency of a magnetron depends on:

choices.choice: the voltage applied to the cathode
the voltage applied to the anode
the size of the cavities
the material from which the cavities are constructed

subject: Technical

question: To produce frequencies in the SHF (microwave) band which of the following could be used: 1. LC oscillator 2. Crystal oscillator 3. Magnetron 4. Klystron

choices.choice: 1 and 2 only
3 and 4 only
3 only

subject: Technical

question: Oscillations in a magnetron are maintained by:

choices.choice: electrons under the influence of a magnetic field energising the cavities
electrons under the influence of an electrostatic field creating negative feedback to the cavities
electromagnetic coupling between anode and cathode
electromagnetic coupling between heater and cathode

subject: Technical

question: The high power pulse of a ground radar system is most likely to be produced by:

choices.choice: crystal oscillator
klystron
klystron followed by a power amplifier
magnetron

subject: Technical
